title: Connection Timeout
body:
Since I've started playing this game, I have been mired by this problem.  After a few minutes of waiting in a queue, I get this message.  In Draft Mode, it cancels my queue.  In regular modes, the clock will tick endlessly.  This is wholly frustrating and I have no reason why it happens.  This is the only game I play where this has ever been an issue, and I have only experienced one 10 second "Attempting to Reconnect" during a game.

But pre-game, it's everywhere.  I've seen only two Post-Game's live, ever, because this is what I get back instantly.

Is there anything I can do about this?

replies.body:
This typically happens due to your connection to the game platform being unstable. I strongly suggest working through the steps in our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure your settings align with what we recommend.

Let me know if you continue to have this issue.

I have gone through this list point for point, even doing the things that my better judgement told me I shouldn't.  Nothing has worked.  It's interesting to note that I'll be in a queue with friends and I'll watch them leave the room, miss the queue, and get the connection timeout immediately afterwards.  It's entirely frustrating and I'm out of answers.

I've bounced my head off of the wall that is this problem for 2 days to no avail.  With no further options left, and no idea what is causing this problem, I'm at a total loss as to what to do next.

I recommend running a set of system logs with our [Hextech Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attach them to a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). One of our tech specialists will be able to dive into those logs and work with you on finding the cause.

Let me know if you run into any issues with this.

I am working through the guide little by little, but testing it is time consuming.  I think I have narrowed it down to either a Firewall issue or a Router issue.  The Hextech Diagnostic tool told me that "Everything was Okay", but the problem persists.  When I have more information I will post it here, and I will continue to work to track down the problem.
